com.github.jnstockley.addressbook

Class Address

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.jnstockley.addressbook.Address

  • public class Address
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds all the necessary commands to create an address object, and to perform full CRUD on the address table of a given database.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    jnstockley

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Address()
      Creates an address object with all the field set to either 0 or an empty string
      Address(int id, int number, java.lang.String street, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String state, java.lang.String zip)
      Creates an address object with the date and time as empty fields mainly used for updating an address
      Address(int id, int number, java.lang.String street, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String state, java.lang.String zip, java.lang.String date, java.lang.String time)
      Creates an address object with no empty fields mainly used for getting all addresses
      Address(int number, java.lang.String street, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String state, java.lang.String zip)
      Creates an address object with the id and date and time as empty values

      • Address

        public Address()

      • Address

        public Address(int number,
               java.lang.String street,
               java.lang.String city,
               java.lang.String state,
               java.lang.String zip)
        Creates an address object with the id and date and time as empty values
        Parameters:
        number - The house number of the address
        street - The street name of the address
        city - The city the address resides in
        state - The state the address resides in
        zip - The zip code of the address

      • Address

        public Address(int id,
               int number,
               java.lang.String street,
               java.lang.String city,
               java.lang.String state,
               java.lang.String zip)
        Creates an address object with the date and time as empty fields mainly used for updating an address
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the address
        number - The house number of the address
        street - The street name of the address
        city - The city the address resides in
        state - The state the address resides in
        zip - The zip code of the address

      • Address

        public Address(int id,
               int number,
               java.lang.String street,
               java.lang.String city,
               java.lang.String state,
               java.lang.String zip,
               java.lang.String date,
               java.lang.String time)
        Creates an address object with no empty fields mainly used for getting all addresses
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the address
        number - The house number of the address
        street - The street name of the address
        city - The city the address resides in
        state - The state the address resides in
        zip - The zip code of the address
        date - The date the address was created
        time - The time the address was created

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Address address)
        Checks all the fields of both addresses if they are equal ignoring case
        Parameters:
        address - The address that is being checked
        Returns:
        Either true if all the fields are equal or false if at least one field is different

      • getAllAddresses

        public java.util.List<Address> getAllAddresses(java.sql.Connection conn)
        Creates a list of addresses stored on a database and returns the address list
        Parameters:
        conn - The MySQL connection
        Returns:
        Either returns a list of addresses or null if there was an error getting all addresses

      • getSimilarAddress

        public java.util.List<Address> getSimilarAddress(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                                 java.lang.String field,
                                                 java.lang.String data)
        Creates a list of similar addresses stored on a database and returns the similar addresses list
        Parameters:
        conn - The MySQL connection
        field - The field used to determine if an address is similar
        data - The value for the passed field to determine if an address is similar
        Returns:
        Either returns a list of similar addresses or null if there was an error getting similar addresses

      • getSimilarAddress

        public java.util.List<Address> getSimilarAddress(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                                 java.lang.String field,
                                                 int data)
        Creates a list of similar addresses stored on a database and returns the similar address list
        Parameters:
        conn - The MySQL connection
        field - The field used to determine if an address is similar
        data - The values for the passed field to determine if an address is similar
        Returns:
        Either returns a list of similar addresses or null if there was an error getting similar addresses

      • getSingularAddress

        public Address getSingularAddress(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                  int id)
        Retrieves a singular address based on the passed ID and returns it
        Parameters:
        conn - The MySQL connection
        id - The ID of the address to be returned
        Returns:
        Either the requested address from the database or null if there was an error getting the address

      • updateAddress

        public Address updateAddress(java.sql.Connection conn,
                             int id,
                             Address updatedAddress)
        Updates a singular address on the database and returns the new address To keep existing data from current address set number to 0 or other fields to empty strings, excluding id, date, and time
        Parameters:
        conn - The MySQL connection
        id - The id of the address to be updated
        updatedAddress - The new address that is going to be updated
        Returns:
        Either returns the address passed, confirming the update or null if the address was not updated

      • insertAddress

        public Address insertAddress(java.sql.Connection conn,
                             Address newAddress)
        Inserts a new address into the database
        Parameters:
        conn - The MySQL connection
        newAddress - The new address that is going to be inserted into the database
        Returns:
        Either returns the passed address, confirming the insert or null if the address wasn't inserted

      • removeAddress

        public boolean removeAddress(java.sql.Connection conn,
                             int id)
        Removes the address at the passed id from the database
        Parameters:
        conn - The MySQL connection
        id - The ID of the address to be removed
        Returns:
        Either true if the address was removed or false if it wasn't
